attributes.action: Request all shops to close until noon on 11th November 2008
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This year marks the 90th Anniversary of 
the signing of the Armistice which ended WW1.  I do not think we will get a public holiday but, shops could close until noon on that day as a mark of respect.  This happens in Australia and New Zealand on Anzac Day and I do not see why we cannot do the same here.

Also, as in Australia and New Zealand on Anzac Day, lets see the Cadet Forces, Scouts, Guides, Boys Brigade etc., taking part in the Remembrance Services all over the Country on the 9th wearing their families medals, especially those won during WW1.
